content:
Posted this on Gitter and thought I'd drop it here, too. @BWPanda (Peter) you have admin permissions here, right? Does something like this seem possible if we wanted it?

In terms of the "recent activity" Github sidebar in Gitter, this is just a brainstorm, but what about a "Github" stream in Zulip that is "announcement only" style and populated via API connection with Github? (Not sure if that's possible but worth looking into maybe)
Need someone with admin access to the GitHub repo as well

https://zulipchat.com/integrations/doc/git

Connect Git to Zulip
Zulip comes with over a hundred native integrations out of the box, and integrates with Zapier, IFTTT, and Hubot to provide hundreds more. Connect the apps you use everyday to Zulip.

Or https://zulipchat.com/integrations/doc/github

Connect GitHub to Zulip
Zulip comes with over a hundred native integrations out of the box, and integrates with Zapier, IFTTT, and Hubot to provide hundreds more. Connect the apps you use everyday to Zulip.
Maybe we can temporarily test it with a repo one of us does have access to. Most of us should have access to add webhooks I think
:clap: Well done you two!
@Geoff St. Pierre wanted something like this I believe, so he'll be happy.
how do i see all the channels not just the ones i'm sub'd to; i can see them in mobile, but not on the web page
Yep, or the 'Add streams' link below the streams listin the left sidebar, or the Settings cog in the top-right, then 'Manage streams'.
